p: The antimicrobial activity was determined by the paper disk diffusion method (100 μg compound in 8 mm paper disk), using meat peptone agar for Staphylococcus aureus and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, peptone yeast agar for Candida albicans, and potato dextrose agar for Aspergillus clavatus. 164 showed moderate antibacterial activity against Staphylococcus aureus NBRC 13276 (5: 24 mm) at a concentration of 100 μg/disk (MIC value: 3.2 μg/mL). Chloramphenicol was used for positive control against S. aureus (1 μg/mL) [ 50].
